Scripts.Text:
TALK Message1

    SET NO_AUTO_ANIM TRUE
    SET ANIMATION TALKING
    FACE SELF TOWARDS PLAYER
    SET TALK_MODE TRUE

    AWAIT TEXTBOX_NUM 2
    SET ANIMATION TOES once
    AWAIT ANIMATION_END
    SET ANIMATION TALKING

    SET TALK_PERSIST TRUE
    AWAIT TALKING_END
    SHOW_TEXTBOX Message2
    SET TALK_PERSIST FALSE

    AWAIT TEXTBOX_NUM 3
    SET ANIMATION SwordPlay once
    AWAIT ANIMATION_END
    SET ANIMATION TALKING
 
    AWAIT TEXTBOX_NUM 4
    SET ANIMATION TOES once
    AWAIT ANIMATION_END
    SET ANIMATION TALKING

    SET TALK_PERSIST TRUE
    AWAIT TALKING_END
    SHOW_TEXTBOX Message2
    SET TALK_PERSIST FALSE

    AWAIT TEXTBOX_NUM 2
    SET DO_TALKING_ANIMATIONS FALSE
    SET SEGMENT_ENTRY SEG_9 MouthSmile

    AWAIT TEXTBOX_NUM 3
    SET DO_TALKING_ANIMATIONS TRUE

    SET TALK_PERSIST TRUE
    AWAIT TALKING_END
    SHOW_TEXTBOX Message3
    SET TALK_PERSIST FALSE

    AWAIT TEXTBOX_NUM 4
    SET ANIMATION Magic1 once
    PLAY SFX NA_SE_VO_LI_AUTO_JUMP
    AWAIT TEXTBOX_NUM 5
    PLAY SFX NA_SE_VO_LI_LASH
    SET ANIMATION Magic2 once
    AWAIT TEXTBOX_NUM 6
    PLAY SFX NA_SE_VO_LI_SWORD_N
    SET ANIMATION Magic3 once

    SET TALK_PERSIST TRUE
    AWAIT TALKING_END

    CCALL NpcM_StopNSwop

    SHOW_TEXTBOX MessageGO
    PLAY SFX NA_SE_VO_LI_FALL_L
    PLAY SFX NA_SE_IT_BOMB_EXPLOSION
    SET REF_ACTOR SELF

    PARTICLE EXPLOSION
        SCALE 400
        SCALE_UPDATE 21
        ACCELERATION 0 10 0
        VELOCITY 0 10 0
        POSITION ABSOLUTE ACTORF.0x24 ACTORF.0x28 ACTORF.0x2C
    ENDPARTICLE 

    SET INVISIBLE true
    SET CASTS_SHADOW FALSE
    AWAIT FOREVER
ENDTALK
Scripts.Name: Test

Messages.Name: Message1
Messages.MessageText:
So, uh, you're probably wondering
why we're in Zelda while this video
is focusing on <B>Banjo-<R>Kazooie.
<New box>
Well, uh, this was genuinely the
simplest way for me to do this.
<New box>
Now then, a word of explanation for
what's about to happen:
<New box>
If you don't know what <G>Stop n' Swop
<W>is about, it was a planned way of 
transferring data between Rare 
games on the <R>Nintendo 64.

Messages.Name: Message3
Messages.MessageText:
Most games didn't implement code 
to support this feature...
<New box>
However, <B>Banjo-<R>Kazooie<W> does!
<New box>
Thanks to some reverse-engineering, we
now know what the game is expecting
in memory to unlock its <G>Stop n' Swop<W>
secrets...
<New box>
The secrets themselves have been 
known for a while, but I've never seen
anyone actually attempt the cartridge
swapperoo method on a real N64...
<New box>
...and so I'm now going to insert the 
payload into memory, and real-world-me 
is going to swap this cartridge for 
<B>Banjo-<R>Kazooie.

Messages.Name: Message2
Messages.MessageText:
Long story short, once the console is
shut off, the contents of the memory
are retained for a short while.
<New box>
If the next game was inserted into the 
machine quickly enough, it could detect 
this and unlock something.
<New box>
Unfortunately, a <R>motherboard revision<W> 
made this difficult, because the memory 
retention time was shortened, and so 
the idea was scrapped.
<New box>
...Why they didn't just use the <G>Memory
Pak <W>for this, I don't know, but that's
entirely beside the point.

Messages.Name: Message4
Messages.MessageText:
Incidentally, I checked, and my <R>N64 
motherboard<W> is dated 1996, so it
should exhibit the "old" memory
retention behaviour...
<New box>
...but, to be safe, I'm going to try
to do it as fast as I can anyway.
<New box>
OK, ready? The payload is now 
in place!
<New box>
<Shift:90>3!
<New box>
<Shift:90>2!
<New box>
<Shift:90>1!
